intro: Mimosa cordobensis, commonly known as the Cordoba mimosa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant has a shrub-like growth habit, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are sensitive to touch, folding shut when disturbed, a trait known as thigmonasty. Mimosa cordobensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, sandy soils.
